Putin is worried about being isolated by

put out an interview with him today in
which they asked him if he was thinking
of constructing a new Iron Curtain no
and we will not we understand how fatal
the Iron Curtain was both we and other

world and they paid a high price for it
we will definitely not go down that path
but mr. Putin's hostility to the West is

conference at Moscow's second world war
museum
none of these veterans would be

speaker tells them that only one country

Russia the nation which defeated fascism
but rhetoric aside how serious is the
Russian threat a more objective view
comes from a former senior officer of
the Russian military General Staff says
he just knew Russia can't conduct
offensive operations against NATO though
it's able to carry out defensive
operations on its border Russia is much
weaker than the West in terms of

doesn't want to look weak it believes
the Americans are trying to encircle
Russia and humiliate it and it wants to
hit back I've been coming to Moscow for
nearly 40 years and watched the
atmosphere change from deep hostility to
relative warmth now it's hostile again
Russia and the West need each other
nowadays so presumably things will
improve at some point but President
Putin is so unpredictable it's hard to
be sure when
all this matters because Russia is still
a nuclear power may be greatly
